D675710A77674723ACCA7D9AC1F275D7.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

2186F155350140BA920D5F4882F05FEF.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

F588E43A21EE4B17A041D124F64CA805.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

48DC55EC970140A599F2B784C130B861.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

9A6B41ECCBB7498CA7F1B999D92B1982.description: Showcase one's skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

669E84499F9D4EA597D557A05F4DB697.description: Relate one's work placement experience to personal and career goals.

DA74649C81424CDAB847B718245172FE.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

F3D36AE6C6714840ABF23F8CE473AAD3.description: Document one's experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization's 'raison d'Ãªtre;' and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one's employability.

6BC210C9AE964012B8D5F112F9052387.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

4A5B073F55A64D3B9F732C06F5D4BE94.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

09F2F9AF92824C459887DC466485FE17.description: Reflect upon one's performance during the interview.

421FE6038423438E8DB4140D786BFC8F.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

45DC24B90999470FAB0C2D296B6EFAE0.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

9EEB69276F274EF4806AE63B7132C1B0.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

61BF0C604ED749A09FBE874779740701.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

D4A33DCCDFCD4C7EB9C0897F3599375A.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code job description; and, conflict resolution.

5B068DAD911140B083C5AB91938CE8A1.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

34E57CE483774300AE7AEBAE74316ADF.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

E556D3EB7089471197865C75177FF753.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

22934815D10544C6B97C4164D449C8D0.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III - Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act: the right to know - the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate - in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse - work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

612A4E511B1446B9A17C5E590C0D7E56.description: Identify how wells are manipulated (e.g., cyclic solvent injection, hot water injection and carbon dioxide as a carrier of heat) to extract more oil.

7149E27476524304BD0BFA8060D91A07.description: Investigate the impacts of oil and gas extraction (e.g., injection of wastewater and fracking) on earth movement.

D81CFDC572F24458AD9B62015616E084.description: Explore how oil and gas being found together impacts the operation of a well.

94063368CCFB496591F7DF6D6B815090.description: Describe the operation of a typical producing well, including the purpose and procedures of well servicing and the role of the Indigenous monitor.

91610438455740FA8E2AEB39C80C684B.description: Explain the steps necessary to bring a well into production.

107C6C2278124BC5A9FBB4BE53498079.description: Explain the financial feasibility (e.g., low quality deposit) and geological challenges of establishing a well.

5F5A3959BC084EC6B7EFE75CB744271A.description: Identify major factors affecting when a drilled well is brought into production.

2F413CF7A0D14AED93FCBC2D7E76959A.description: Explore the types of drilling (e.g., directional and fracking) used based on the structure of the oil field.

0B39CA717BFD49E89BDB9933CAB4D9E5.description: Describe the parts and operation of a drilling rig.

77338B2E4E5F41FCAA41F78702D99FC0.description: Summarize the preparation of a drilling site including the role of an Indigenous Elder, Knowledge Keeper or monitor in identifying historic activities (e.g., sweats, sun dances, hunting and fishing sites, and ceremonial sites).

57B736C9F5644FFA8E028BF22AC67A4D.description: Explain the importance of oil and gas companies conducting feasibility studies and environmental impact assessments prior to establishing a drilling site.

D7C1B3BF4EC6469983E4EB9BFB35AB1D.description: Discuss when a mining or petroleum company can officially be released from responsibility of a site.

F5C042C5D4434E3EA7821E4F000AAC13.description: Investigate other uses (e.g., hydrogen or carbon dioxide gas storage and tourism) of underground mine formations and petroleum reservoirs.

150AEA6F286C4ED991DE5D30C3222609.description: Conduct a case study of the decommissioning and reclamation of Cluff Lake uranium mine including: environmental effects (e.g., water quality, radiation and revegetation); site components (e.g., mine areas, mill complex and tailings); future monitoring; and, land use.

FA5C75E41B634E0C935A1F58178A9103.description: Explore how native prairie grasses, wetland and forested areas are reestablished.

B7BFB49295B64E3E83FF8A5143D6AF7E.description: Discuss the role of Indigenous partnerships, resource companies and The Saskatchewan First Act in reestablishing sites.

BFA8718335C64F5CB78C6DC58C82AF43.description: Explain the importance of continuous monitoring of a reclaimed site.

07936C67FDE342C09AFB28606B8D0FC1.description: Explore environmental elements (e.g., replacing the soil and aggregate, planting trees and having proper runoff for lakes and streams) in decommissioning and reclaiming a site.

BE36BF702ECF4EB8A8F685CB60092526.description: Describe how an end-of-life plan is developed to determine the real cost and what needs to be done for each project.

046ACEC7AF814F6F952D6A90E0B263DA.description: Identify the elements of a decommissioning and reclamation plan.

AA915C6B31A04C849B889EBEB4FE7C33.description: Describe the role of organizations (e.g., Saskatchewan Environmental Quality Committee) in quality control of decommissioning and reclamation projects.

B00E80C11D854671A35EF1673D929C51.description: Discuss the current government acts and regulations overseeing the end-of-life process for mining and drilling operations.

5B2EFE1200034BBFBDDA213C4FB95473.description: Analyze the impact of orphaned mines and wells on the natural water supply (i.e., sustainability of the animals, plants and the health of communities including the Indigenous peoples).

E71613FAF7DA483E81E5ED5F998F6809.description: Investigate the historical development of decommissioning and reclamation of mines and orphaned wells, including the involvement of First Nations and MÃ©tis peoples.

05071D5EA99A4DE182CE286D2AD3F40F.description: Explain the concept of decommissioning and its importance.

91329C3A1767416E92058402BA0AA799.description: Examine the processes involved in the decommissioning and reclamation of mines and orphaned wells.

3875E0590F004FECB9DB8A39F1521D8C.description: Trace the advancement in technology of different types of equipment (e.g., drilling, robotic vehicles and surveying) including changes being suggested for the future.

5E5A7521F3F94F50AAB9B745AA9D0AF3.description: Investigate Canadian organizations involved in research and development of technology in the energy and mining industries.

DFF51A13B0D84583B1AAEDCF80304A05.description: Examine how technology is used in preventative and predictive maintenance programs.

6D438F07F68949FE8D5A870BBACC78BD.description: Compare the technology used for hard and soft rock mining.

89186F1D58C141308CEE336129C2D20C.description: Explore how development of technology in other industries is adaptable to the energy and mining sectors.

33A672F194334A45A742C977D2720413.description: Explain how the energy and mining sectors gather data and why the data compiled through exploration and other energy and mining processes must be credible to be useful in technology and in other areas.

105EDD00974C479FA15B518955142D7E.description: Research the effects of advances in technology in one or more of the following areas: artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML); exploration techniques; managing and processing data (e.g., 3-D imaging of land and mines, resource reserves and vehicle maintenance); safer working conditions; coding; communication; virtual reality for training workers; real time access to experts while working; remote equipment management; use of drones in hazardous and confined spaces; autonomous vehicles, drilling and tunnel boring systems; vehicle and ground monitoring; smart sensors; distribution and marketing of minerals and products; edge computing using cameras to optimize processes; reduced environmental and ecological impact (air and water quality); decreased use of water; smart mines and their impact on the work force; and, higher productivity.

3A0D77B27FF84ECEA4F77308CB2DCB46.description: Examine the advancements in technology in the energy and mining industries.

DAC1D96A391544D9B3160E0B3D9D693B.description: Explore the direct connection and importance of the relationship Indigenous people have with the land.

4AC459E659974A129DB9F45E15B945F4.description: Examine how different worldviews (e.g., First Nations and MÃ©tis and Western) impact human interaction with the land.

DBC8B3D1893C428A88DB67489EA03412.description: Reflect on land sustainability from First Nations and MÃ©tis worldviews (e.g., keepers of the land).

6A30DA77D75548B2B279139858274CAC.description: Investigate sustainable practices in energy and mining to maintain water resources.

B315A536032C455BAAC6A279BE6F3520.description: Explore the impact of renewable energy sources on the sustainability of the energy and mining industries.

73198D6964044E0BBEEF561549396DBD.description: Explain how conservation relates to sustainability and long-term planning.

6790F703F74C43B69A35FF491076D6A8.description: Research sustainable practices in the energy and mining industries.

B804C0B14FBE4AC79C39A38272C97059.description: Investigate how Saskatchewan's energy and mining industries provide increased national supply chain security.

ACBB677916FE4045A161691A7D409AA4.description: Discuss the role of social media in the spreading of information and how to determine fact versus fiction.

FF58B33998244B2E91D133878D47761A.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of continuing to explore and mine mineral and petroleum resources.

DCD4374B4AC4493DAD09AB7DDADB85BB.description: Explore the pressure placed on non-renewable mineral resources (e.g., silver and lithium) due to developments in technology (e.g., microchips).

16D07F8869B24BAE84F3EABF2D130D3C.description: Propose a plan to sustain the energy sector when non-renewable resources are gone.

285780533A4940AB8B8A18EB4EC7F3D2.description: Describe actions that can be taken to live and work more sustainably with non-renewable resources today and into the future.

7B87E51ECCC44D07968A1A85ED7736CB.description: Critique the implications of Saskatchewan's current and sustainable levels of energy use, in the context of climate change, global economic demand and available resources.

3E019868E1D04F8B9824DF1E45F0FE73.description: Interpret data comparing Canadian energy and resource consumption to the rest of North America and the world to determine the sustainability of Canadian resources.

66E3E8D2DA484710962866D2AF44A8D8.description: Examine the sustainability of the energy and mining industries.

D9D839CCD3FF4B9EBBC3EC480C8A9E7D.description: Describe the effects of pumping on a water table, surface water and water levels in general including the formation of a drawdown cone.

33DCED179649418E8F096300553662D8.description: Research the connection between groundwater and surface streams.

9424D87B5AED4289AF526A184A80B8D4.description: Explain the evolution of groundwater flow along a path in terms of flow path (length), residence time and groundwater quality (fresh, brackish and saline).

66FFA8806D764024B3FAA575590E1399.description: Research the mechanism, forces, and material properties that result in and control groundwater movement.

328D643A70D2470080978E3FA14B0A4D.description: Explore the chief hazards and risks (e.g., high voltage power lines, turbines and ground falls) faced by workers in energy and mining industries.

2FDD5DAF80E5492FB85589D7E620AA4A.description: Assess the consequences of failure of one or more worker safety programs or controls, whether through accident or not following established procedures.

24B8074B81874B9791483CB77FB21625.description: Explain the importance of emergency response teams, drills and procedures at a mine site.

231C13881D224DA695E2D4925944E99F.description: Identify potential fire hazards and prevention procedures in underground mines, well sites and processing plants.

42472867345A44BDADCFAE94B433F839.description: Discuss the hierarchy of controls including elimination, substitution, engineering, administrative controls and PPE.

7939359FAF754F98BE24F399F77679C6.description: Describe the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) (e.g., masks, ear plugs, safety goggles and footwear) for respiratory, hearing, sight and body protection.

D811898D96844AB18B636550F9705D02.description: Explore the safety regulations, procedures, equipment and personnel at local or regional mining, drilling and power generation sites.

69815509CAEE470AAB9F6DD9DE0B5CEA.description: Investigate ways to mitigate damage to equipment because of unsafe work activities or environments.

1FB4B0B85F584CBEBB1768C242DA9700.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury because of unsafe work activities (e.g., lifting heavy objects, travelling underground and blasting) or environments (e.g., working around large and noisy equipment, radiation exposure and working underground).

C5DD1FF8DF184BEAA0758C710B6416C7.description: Examine the reliance on basic safety policies when using advanced technology.

C789C4C970644042A2E1AFFBEB023652.description: Explain how the Globally Harmonized System (GHS) is used.

68FC29C5304049268C5921AC0DD7862D.description: Explore the use of zero energy state and lockout tagout features of equipment.

FFEC0CC2680047AE825C11F5F10D5131.description: Identify strategies to mitigate risks and potential safety hazards in energy, petroleum and mining operations.

2C1A287948214A609498D12BCBDF6FD5.description: Analyze the historical safety statistics on injuries in the energy and mining industries.

CB0AF0E575E04311977B28DD8DB78A8A.description: Explore the safety standards of the energy and mining industries.
